title: A generation growing up without their mum | ABC NEWS
description: Millions of domestic workers move to Asian business hubs like Singapore and Hong Kong to secure their family's financial future. But it's left a generation of children to grow up without their mothers.   #ABCAsiaPacific  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Former British ambassador to US arrested over revelations from Epstein files | ABC NEWS
description: Former UK ambassador to the US, Peter Mandelson has been arrested amid an investigation into alleged misconduct in public office.  The former UK cabinet minister is facing allegations that he shared confidential information with the late convicted sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein.  Revelations from the Epstein files continue to rock the British government as British Prime Minister Keir Starmer cops scathing criticism over his decision to appoint Lord Mandelson to the high-profile post. title: Albanese backs call to remove Andrew from line of succession | ABC NEWS
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has written to his UK counterpart Keir Starmer to endorse calls to remove former prince Andrew from the line of succession.  Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor remains eighth in line to the throne despite having been arrested at Sandringham after the Epstein files prompted allegations of misconduct in office as a trade envoy.  Australia is the first Commonwealth nation to back the proposal, which will require the approval of all Commonwealth nations and Westminster. title: Will a Trump Tower be built on the Gold Coast? | ABC NEWS
description: Property developer David Young plans to build a 91-storey Trump Tower in the heart of the Gold Coast. He says it will be "tasteful and expensive", attracting the "world's wealthiest people". The Gold Coast's acting mayor says a development application has not yet been submitted to the council. title: ICC begins hearing allegations of Duterte's crimes against humanity | ABC NEWS
description: The International Criminal Court has begun hearings on alleged crimes against humanity by former Philippine president Rodrigo Duterte.  He is facing three charges over his brutal war on drugs during his time as the president of the Philippines and the mayor of Davao. ICC prosecutor Mame Niang is accusing the former South East Asian leader of widespread and systematic deadly attacks on his country’s population, which resulted in thousands of deaths including children. title: US sends world's largest aircraft carrier to Middle East amid threats of attack on Iran | ABC NEWS
description: Diplomats from the US and Iran will meet for a third round of nuclear talks in Geneva, despite rising tensions in the region. The Iranian Foreign Ministry has promised to respond to any attacks ordered by Donald Trump as the US deploys more fighter jets and cargo planes to the Middle East. It comes as Iranian university students rally in Tehran in a new wave of anti-regime protests. description: The government has committed $230 million to the final plannings stage for a high-speed rail line between Newcastle and Sydney. The government wants the project to be 'shovel ready' in two years' time. title: Drug lord El Mencho’s death triggers deadly attacks in Mexico | ABC NEWS
description: At least 25 members of the Mexican National Guard have been killed in six separate retaliatory attacks after cartel boss 'El Mencho' was killed in a siege in the Tapalpa region.  Chaos erupted in the tourist town of Puerto Vallarta as cartel members torched vehicles and set up roadblocks across Mexico.  Mexico’s Defence Minister Ricardo Trevilla Trejo paid an emotional tribute to the fallen soldiers, while President Claudia Sheinbaum promised to bring 'calm' and 'security' to the country's streets. title: Suspected human remains found during search for 85yo Chris Baghsarian | ABC NEWS
description: Suspected human remains have been found in the search for abducted grandfather Chris Baghsarian. The unconfirmed remains were found near a golf club in Pitt Town in Sydney's north-west. 85-year-old Baghsarian was snatched from his home in North Ryde on February 13. Police believe it was a case of mistaken identity. title: Record snowfall blankets north-eastern US, 30 million under blizzard warnings | ABC NEWS
description: A powerful blizzard has blasted north-eastern parts of the US, covering New York City in a thick blanket of snow. Parts of Providence and Rhode Island saw a metre of snow from the storm. Thousands of flights have been cancelled and schools closed while more than 30 million people remain under blizzard warnings. title: Suspected human remains found in search for kidnapped man Chris Baghsarian | ABC NEWS
description: Suspected human remains have been found in the search for abducted grandfather Chris Baghsarian, who police say was mistakenly kidnapped.   Mr Baghsarian was snatched from his North Ryde property home and bundled into an SUV about 5am on February 13, with investigators confident the 85-year-old was not the intended target of the abduction plot.   Law enforcement sources had told the ABC offenders were likely targeting a figure with links to the Alameddine crime family.   Following extensive inquiries, detectives located what is believed to be human remains near a golf club in Pitt Town in the north-west fringes of Sydney about 8am on Tuesday. title: Russia casts net wide for mercenary recruits: fmr presidential adviser | ABC NEWS
description: Former presidential adviser Fiona Hill says Vladimir Putin will not take a backward step in Ukraine, despite for the first time losing more personnel as casualties than he's been able to recruit. Ms Hill says Russia is casting its net wide for mercenary recruits as well as reinforcements from strategic partners and the country has now transitioned to a war time economy. title: PM signals willingness to support move to remove Andrew from line of succession | ABC NEWS
description: Anthony Albanese has told British Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer that the Australian government "would agree to any proposal to remove" Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor from the line of royal succession.  The former prince remains eighth in line to the throne.  Mr Albanese is the first leader of a Commonwealth country to confirm support for legislation to strip the former prince of his succession rights. title: What needs to be done to remove Andrew from the line of succession? | ABC NEWS
description: The prime ministers of Australia and New Zealand have written letters to the UK leader endorsing a push to remove Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor from the line of succession. Constitutional law expert Anne Twomey says it needs the agreement from 14 countries to remove the former prince.
